comment.author: 47393018@N00
comment._content: Sara Jane Lippincott (1823-1904) was better known by the pseudonym Grace Greenwood. She was an American author, poet and lecturer. One of the first women to gain access into the Congressional press galleries, she used her questions to advocate for social reform and women's rights. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F0CE2DB163FE63AB... www.picturehistory.com/product/id/15865 www.iath.virginia.edu/utc/sentimnt/greenwoodhp.html en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sara_Jane_Lippincott www.bchistory.org/beavercounty/booklengthdocuments/AMilob...

comment.author: 7701600@N03
comment._content: Ok. So she wasn't a petrified bride then by the last comment. Maybe she was overworked, stressed by the amount of push she had to use to get men/society to recognize women did exist beyond slavery. Bravo for her. But geez, she looks how I feel. Since there is no copyright on this I HAVE to use her face for my icon!!!! If anyone has a problem with that just let me know!
